EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace at Position(x=0.0, y=0.0) outfitted with burner‑inserters, linked transport belts, and a wooden chest.
• Stone Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=0.0) similarly configured.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
Consists of:
• Burner‑Mining Drill at Position(x=-15.0, y=-50.0)
• Wooden Chest at Position(x=-13.5, y=-51.5)
• Dedicated transport belts facilitating ore transfer between these entities.

### Steam Power Generation System
Consists of:
• Boiler at Position(x=8.0, y=20.5) providing steam output.
• Steam Engines deployed at multiple locations:
  – (0.5, 9.5)
  – (18.5, 11.5)
  – (1.5, 13.5)
  – (13.5, 14.5)
  – (19.5, 14.5)
  – (22.5, 18.5)
  – (17.5, 20.5)
  – (12.5, 21.5)
  – (4.5, 23.5)
• Note: An extra steam engine designated for placement near Position(x≈8.5, y≈22.5) remains unplaceable due to persistent congestion.

### Automation Research Lab
Consists of:
• A laboratory unit configured for processing automation science pack inputs (currently unpowered).

### Electrical and Transport Infrastructure
Consists of:
• Interconnected Electricity Groups linking power poles across the network.
• Multiple Belt Groups and Pipe Groups that provide material and fluid connectivity throughout the facility.

ERROR TIPS
─────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue
  – Issue: The extra steam engine continually fails to be placed because severe congestion—marked by overlapping and misaligned burner‑inserters and transport belts—in the boiler area obstructs the clear buildable space near Position(x≈8.5, y≈22.5).
  – Recommendation: Perform a thorough manual inspection of the boiler area and all surrounding connection interfaces; remove, reposition, or adjust conflicting entities to free sufficient clearance, or alternatively, relocate the extra steam engine to a less congested area or modify the boiler layout for improved spacing.
